page.title: 07TREGONY - TOURISM
page.content: CLOSE TO THE R.FAL AND CHANNAL COAST TREGONY IS THE GATEWAY TO THE ROSELAND PENINSULAR, NOW CLASSIFIE AN AREA OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY .ONCE AN UPMARKET TOURIST AREA, THE HUGE GROWTH OF THE INDUSTRY IN THE PAST 25 YEARS HAS HAD A HEAVY SEASON IMPACT ON THE AREA PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT IN THE MANY TOURIST SERVICES. TREGONYS FARMS PROVIDE B.B. AS DO VILLAGE HOUSEHOLDERS . SINCE 1963 A CARAVAN PARK OPENED BEHINO FORE STREET. SHOPS SELL HOLIDAY WEARS AND OPEN ON SUNDAY MORNINGS IN THE SEASON AND TAKE EXTRA STAFF.THE GIFT SHOP OPENS FOR THE SUMMER MONTHS: KEA HOUSE,ONCE A PUB, FUNCTIONS AS A RESTAURANT,BUT EFFORTS TO OPEN A TEA SHOP HAVE FAILED.TOURISM HAS BOASTED TREGONYS JULY CARNIVAL AND WEALTH VISTORS HAVE ENCOURAGED THE OPENING OF 2 ANTIQUE SHOPS.SINCE 1976 5 COTTAGES HAVE BECOME HOLIDAY HOMES.
